entry.title: SENATOR MERKLEY ANNOUNCES 2026 RE-ELECTION CAMPAIGN
entry.summary: July 10, 2025 5:30 p.m. On Wednesday, Oregon Senator Jeff Merkley announced that he will seek re-election to a fourth term in 2026. A campaign release said Merkley is pledging to continue to fight for working families and stand firm against what he believes are growing threats to democracy, freedom and economic justice. Merkley said,...

entry.title: Former Douglas County Jail Deputy, Inmate Both Face Charges After Isolation Cell Incident
entry.summary: Former Douglas County corrections deputy Jeremiah Heredia faces assault and misconduct charges after allegedly striking an inmate in an isolation cell. The inmate, who reportedly flicked toilet water at Heredia, is also charged with aggravated harassment.

entry.title: Phoenix School Faces Setback, But Support for Students Remains Strong
entry.summary: Phoenix Charter School’s sponsorship by Roseburg Public Schools has ended, halting its high school program for now. But Phoenix School will continue to provide youth services and support, vowing to help students and families as they navigate their next steps.

entry.title: Court Takes No Action as Charges Remain Pending for Former Deputy
entry.summary: Former Douglas County sheriff’s deputy Jeremiah Heredia has been released from jail without charges filed, following his arrest for alleged misconduct. The DA now has up to 30 days to decide whether to proceed, as a related jail harassment case may be influencing the timeline.

entry.title: Former Deputy Walks Free as Prosecutors Hold Off on Charges
entry.summary: Former Douglas County sheriff’s deputy Jeremiah Heredia has been released from jail without charges filed, following his arrest for alleged misconduct. The DA now has up to 30 days to decide whether to proceed, as a related jail harassment case may be influencing the timeline.

entry.title: Oregon Transportation Crisis Deepens with Massive ODOT Layoffs
entry.summary: ODOT began significant layoffs Monday, cutting 483 jobs due to a failed legislative funding package. Portland transportation also faces layoffs, prompting urgent calls for solutions amid declining revenues.

entry.title: Dog trainer lawsuit dismissed
entry.summary: A lawsuit filed by a dog trainer who claimed his name and reputation were besmirched by several former clients is finally over, some five years after the turbulent saga — which included jail time for the trainer — began.
